column10: Not a paraben. Not likely to cause irritation and acne.

column2: Ethyl Ascorbic Acid, Vitamin C Ethyl Ether, Ascorbyl Ethyl Ether, Ascorbic Acid Ethyl Ether
column10: Antioxidant, brightening. Risk of irritation for sensitive skin
column55: This stable form of Vitamin C helps to brighten the skin and reduce excess oil production. It can help balance oily skin while providing antioxidant protection, reducing shine, and preventing clogged pores.
column57: This stable form of Vitamin C penetrates the skin to stimulate collagen production, helping to reduce the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles. It also provides antioxidant protection, preventing further skin aging by neutralizing free radicals.
column59: This stable form of Vitamin C promotes collagen production, improving skin firmness and elasticity. It also provides antioxidant protection against environmental damage.
column61: This stable form of Vitamin C brightens the skin and promotes collagen production, which helps to smooth out uneven skin texture and minimize the appearance of pores. It also reduces hyperpigmentation, contributing to a more even complexion.
column65: This stable form of Vitamin C helps to brighten the skin by inhibiting melanin production and promoting collagen synthesis. It effectively reduces dullness, giving the skin a more radiant and even tone.
column69: This stable form of Vitamin C brightens the skin and reduces the appearance of blemishes by promoting collagen production and inhibiting melanin production. It also has antioxidant properties that help heal and prevent future blemishes.
